attributes.action: Amend currently proposed lockdown legislation for Places of Worship
attributes.additional_details:
Restrictions must be approached in a positive way rather than negatively and give both individuals and police a clear indication of the spirit in which they should understand and apply their powers.

It is also vital to ensure the fundamental human right to worship in community with others is maintained. If businesses, schools and universities remain open without the requirement to wear masks, there is no sound reasoning to restrict the right of worship with others when taking due precautions.
attributes.background:
Proposed legislation states
"Places of Worship will be closed, unless they are being used for:"
(and then lists exemptions)

A more positive and clear wording is:
"Places of Worship will remain open for:"
(listing existing exemptions plus)
"Socially distanced worship wearing appropriate PPE"

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548621

But we're not sure exactly what you'd like the proposed legislation to achieve. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, although we can't accept petitions submitted in the name or organisations rather than individuals.
